page.title: 19Burton Hill House School.
page.content: The{present building}was erected in 1846. First of all, it was a{private {house.}In 1947, the{Shaftesbury {Society }opened it as a school for the physically handicapped. At first, it was girls only,but then boys joined as well. Stables were converted into chapel, hydrotherapy pool and physiotherapy room. Classrooms and dormitries were built on.{Today,}there are 25 pupils aged between 11 to 16 years. The lake has been cleared and stocked with fish. A new greenhouse and garden area was built. Plans have been made for new field studies and leisure centre called{Abbey Leaze. This will be use for groups of able bodied and disabled to enjoy the school grounds and local area. In our grounds, we have woodland, lawns and water, which encourages wildlife that we can observe.
